this is me trying#Taylor Swift#This is me trying is a beautiful look at the importance of trying. One perspective to consider when analyzing the song is that of an individual who is battling addiction or mental health issues. "This is me trying" can be seen as a powerful anthem for those who are fighting every day to stay sober or heal from emotional trauma. It serves as a reminder that the act of trying, even if it goes unnoticed or uncelebrated, is a significant achievement in itself.#https://i.ibb.co/rdqdW6R/Folklore.png#I was so ahead of the curve, the curve became a sphere,Fell behind all of my classmates, and I ended up here. Pouring out my heart to a stranger, But I didn't pour the whiskey#1
illicit affairs#Taylor Swift#First it is important to note the meaning of the words “illicit affairs” - an illicit affair is defined as something that is “activity or situation is one that people do not approve of.” This song is a true story told from beginning to end. There are several ways this song could be interpreted. Such as Taylor has started engaging in an affair or a friend with benefits situation with someone who she knows has a significant other. The story is told as at first it is such a thrill but it all inevitably comes to reality and there is no future only sadness and regret.#https://i.ibb.co/rdqdW6R/Folklore.png#And that's the thing about illicit affairs And clandestine meetings and stolen stares They show their truth one single time But they lie, and they lie, and they lie A million little times And you wanna scream Don't call me "kid" Don't call me "baby" Look at this godforsaken mess that you made me You showed me colors You know I can't see with anyone else#2
champagne problems#Taylor Swift#Essentially Champagne Problems is a ballad from the perspective of someone who has said no to a proposal due to her mental struggles. The song's structure is particularly noteworthy, as it showcases the progression of emotions from the proposer's excitement and anticipation before the proposal to his confusion and heartbreak after the rejection. The music builds and swells in response to these emotional shifts, adding an additional layer of depth to the already powerful lyrics. In the third verse, the song takes a surprising turn as the protagonist reveals that the proposer has moved on and is now engaged to someone else. This unexpected twist adds a bittersweet element to the song, as we see how life moves on even in the face of heartbreak.#https://i.ibb.co/DkWcpw6/evermore.jpg#One for the money, two for the show I never was ready, so I watch you go Sometimes you just don't know the answer 'Til someone's on their knees and asks you "She would've made such a lovely bride What a shame she's fucked in the head, " they said But you'll find the real thing instead She'll patch up your tapestry that I shred#3
right where you left me#TaylorSwift#Right, where you left me, is described by Taylor herself as “The song is about a girl who stayed forever in the exact spot where her heart was broken, completely frozen in time.” The song is a lyrical masterpiece that can be viewed through many lenses, making it relatable to a diverse audience. It speaks to the universal experience of heartbreak and the difficulty of moving on from the pain of loss. Additionally, it can be interpreted as a reflection of the struggles that come with mental health, as one can feel isolated and stuck in a moment of time.#https://i.ibb.co/DkWcpw6/evermore.jpg#One for the money, two for the show I never was ready, so I watch you go Sometimes you just don't know the answer 'Til someone's on their knees and asks you "She would've made such a lovely bride What a shame she's fucked in the head, " they said But you'll find the real thing instead She'll patch up your tapestry that I shred#4
all too well (10 Minute Version)#Taylor Swift#All too well( 10 Minute Version) is an extended version of “All Too Well” which was released on her Taylor’s Version of Red. This 10 minute masterpiece follows a beautiful tragic love story from start to finish with powerful emotion and introspect. . The extended runtime allows for a more nuanced exploration of the aftermath of a failed relationship. The song shifts from moments of intense pain and longing to moments of self-reflection and acceptanceThe Extended version of this song gives Taylor the opportunity to show the full cycle of emotion that comes with heartbreak. The song is rumored to be about her relationship with Jake Gyllenhaal, and the extended version includes additional details that add to the emotional depth of the story. It's a testament to Taylor's ability to connect with her audience on a deeply personal level, making her music relatable and powerful.#https://i.ibb.co/FwZsr6p/REDTV.jpg#And maybe we got lost in translation Maybe I asked for too much But maybe this thing was a masterpiece 'til you tore it all up Running scared, I was there I remember it all too well And you call me up again just to break me like a promise So casually cruel in the name of being honest I'm a crumpled up piece of paper lying here 'Cause I remember it all, all, all Too well#5
tolerate it#Taylor Swift#Tolerate it is a perfect picture of a one-sided relationship. The song delves into the feelings of a person who is putting in all the effort in a relationship, only to receive little in return. The song perfectly portrays the idea that love can be painful and that sometimes we are willing to endure even the most difficult circumstances for the sake of love. The song explores the themes of sacrifice and unrequited love, as the protagonist tries to hold on to a relationship that is slowly slipping away.#https://i.ibb.co/DkWcpw6/evermore.jpg#I wait by the door like I'm just a kid Use my best colors for your portrait Lay the table with the fancy shit And watch you tolerate it If it's all in my head, tell me now Tell me I've got it wrong somehow I know my love should be celebrated But you tolerate it#6
Marjorie#Taylor Swift#Taylor Swift's song "Marjorie" is a moving homage to her late grandmother, opera singer Marjorie Finlay. The song tackles themes of loss, sadness, and the ability of remembrance to preserve the lives of loved ones. Taylor considers her grandmother's influence on her life and work throughout the song, as well as the ways in which her memories of her continue to inspire and direct her. The lyrics depict a woman that was larger than life, had a strong voice, and had an unbounded energy.The fundamental tenet of "Marjorie" is the notion that our loved ones live on in our memories of them. Taylor sings of the solace she derives from thinking of her grandmother. #https://i.ibb.co/DkWcpw6/evermore.jpg#Never be so polite, you forget your power Never wield such power, you forget to be polite And if I didn't know better I'd think you were listening to me now If I didn't know better I'd think you were still around#7
Getaway Car#Taylor Swift# At the heart of "Getaway Car" is the idea of escape and freedom. The song explores the themes of betrayal and abandonment, as the protagonist realizes that her partner was only using her as a way to escape from another relationship. The lyrics describe the rush of the initial romance, as the two lovers speed away in a stolen car, trying to outrun their problems. However, as the song progresses, the protagonist begins to realize that her partner was never truly committed to their relationship and that he was simply using her to get away from someone else.A key perspective is from a person who got in a relationship that was spawned by an action of cheating. And the ending will never be good and they both are finally realizing that.#https://i.ibb.co/PQDCzCN/Rep.jpg# Key Lyrics Not Available Yet!#8
The Man#Taylor Swift#"The Man" by Taylor Swift is a powerful and thought-provoking song that tackles the important issue of gender inequality and the double standards that women face in society. Through her lyrics, Taylor highlights the fact that if she were a man, her behavior would be judged differently, and that women are often held to a different standard than men.What makes this song even more impactful is that Taylor has stated that the examples of inequality she explores in the bridge of the song are all based on her personal experiences. This adds a raw and personal element to the song, making it all the more relatable to listeners who may have faced similar issues.Overall, "The Man" is a deeply insightful and honest exploration of the challenges and frustrations that women face in a world where gender inequality is still a major issue. With its powerful message and honest lyrics, this song is a true testament to Taylor Swift's artistry and her commitment to speaking out on important social issues#https://i.ibb.co/4PdNh3c/Lover.png# Key Lyrics Not Available Yet!#9
Would've Could've Should've#Taylor Swift#"Would've, Could've, Should've" by Taylor Swift is a hauntingly beautiful exploration of regret and the what-ifs that come with missed opportunities. The song is deeply personal, as it is widely speculated to be about her relationship with John Mayer, which began when she was just 19 and he was 32.The lyrics delve into the pain and sadness that comes with looking back on a past relationship and wondering what could have been, had things been different. Taylor's introspective voice conveys a sense of regret and longing as she explores the choices that were made and the ones that could have been.This song is a powerful reminder of the importance of being intentional in our relationships, and the consequences that can come with making the wrong choices. It encourages us to learn from our mistakes and to move forward with a renewed sense of purpose, so that we can avoid looking back with regret in the future.#https://i.ibb.co/nCvFf8k/Midnights.jpg# Key Lyrics Not Available Yet!#10
You're On Your Own Kid#Taylor Swift# You’re on your own kid is a very personalized song where taylor explores her journey through emotion and relaizing she is all she has. The exploration and honesty of her eating disorder and some failures she has made along the way combined with the extensive amount of effort she has put into building herself into who she is now is portrayed perfectly in her progressively energetic song. It is a very uplifting and inspiring ballad, especially from seeing Taylor grow to who she is now as this song was released in 2022.#https://i.ibb.co/nCvFf8k/Midnights.jpg# Key Lyrics Not Available Yet!#11
my tears ricochet#Taylor Swift#My tears ricochet is really teh vision of betrayal. Someone you loved so much betraying you and hurting you- stabbing you in the back. And though the hurt did kill you you know it hurt them too deep down, You may miss the person but you realize they hurt you and betrayed you. There is so much depth to betrayal and heartbreak and my tears ricochet really explores all aspects of this. This also does not have to be a romantic betrayal- as it is widely speculated Taylor wrote this about her former producer who sold the rights to her song without consulting with her.#https://i.ibb.co/rdqdW6R/Folklore.png# Key Lyrics Not Available Yet!#12
cardigan#Taylor Swift#Cardigan is a very subjective song with several ways to view or perceive it. The main and deep picture painted by Taylor is of a girl who was insecure and found a lover that made her feel special right when she needed it. He then hurts her in a way she had never been hurt- the betrayal being worse since all of her confidence was built by him. She knew the pain would last forever and used scars symbolically several times throughout the song.  She hurts so bad- but still holds on to the smallest amount of hope because he will forever and always be the reason for her happiness.#https://i.ibb.co/rdqdW6R/Folklore.png# Key Lyrics Not Available Yet!#13
Cruel Summer#Taylor Swift# Cruel Summer by Taylor Swift is a passionate and intense depiction of a summer romance that begins as a no-strings-attached affair, but quickly becomes a one-sided love story. The song perfectly captures the pain and confusion that comes with falling in love with someone who doesn't feel the same way, and the frustration of being unable to express those feelings due to the established boundaries of the relationship. #https://i.ibb.co/4PdNh3c/Lover.png# Key Lyrics Not Available Yet!#14
Clean#Taylor Swift#"Clean" is a deeply personal song for Taylor Swift as it explores her journey of overcoming a traumatic experience of sexual assault and the emotional healing that followed. The song was written after a difficult court battle where Taylor was able to stand up for herself and win, but it also speaks to the experiences of other women who struggle to have their voices heard. Taylor has also shared that "Clean" represents the idea of breaking free from the opinions of others and realizing that one's own worth is not defined by external factors- that is when you are finally clean. The song has a sense of liberation and empowerment that is both powerful and inspiring.#1989# Key Lyrics Not Available Yet!#15
